articles.description: World number two Iga Swiatek accepts a one-month suspension after testing positive for a banned substance.
articles.title: Iga Swiatek: World number two accepts one-month doping suspension

articles.description: Frank Lampard seeks a rebuilding of his reputation after being appointed Coventry City boss, writes BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Frank Lampard seeks redemption as Coventry City manager

articles.description: The boss's bumper payday has caused a rift in the Rugby Football Union - BBC rugby union correspondent Chris Jones explains what the issues are.
articles.title: Bill Sweeney: RFU chief's bonus and the ongoing controversy

articles.description: England off-spinner Shoaib Bashir says he is "not perfect" and "learning on the job" after his four wickets on the opening day of the first Test against New Zealand.
articles.title: England v New Zealand: Shoaib Bashir is 'not perfect' and 'learning on the job'

articles.description: Sam Prendergast is preferred to Jack Crowley at fly-half in the Ireland team for Saturday's game against Australia.
articles.title: Ireland v Australia: Sam Prendergast at fly-half over Jack Crowley

articles.description: Arne Slot's Liverpool machine hits top gear to outclass Real Madrid and show something special is stirring at Anfield.
articles.title: Liverpool 2-0 Real Madrid: 'Something special brewing at Slot's incredible Reds'

articles.description: Real Madrid record a third loss in the Champions League as Kylian Mbappe struggles to impress, are they really at risk of being eliminated?
articles.title: Kylian Mbappe 'hasn't delivered when Madrid needed him' - could Real Madrid be set for Champions League exit?

articles.description: Nottingham Forest striker Chris Wood speaks to BBC Sport about his goalscoring run, his manager Nuno Espirito Santo and feeling appreciated.
articles.title: Chris Wood interview: Nottingham Forest striker on feeling appreciated and best form of career

articles.description: A senior steward who has been fired by Formula 1's governing body says the FIA is "running out of people to do those jobs".
articles.title: F1: Fired steward warns FIA is 'running out of people to do those jobs'

articles.description: Harrogate Town boss Simon Weaver is the longest-serving current manager in the top four divisions - well ahead of Man City's Pep Guardiola and Arsenal's Mikel Arteta.
articles.title: FA Cup: The father-and-son team at Harrogate Town hoping to hit the jackpot
